page.title: 05PUBLIC HOUSES IN CUCKFIELD
page.content: There are 5 public houses located on the main road running through the village. They are:- The Ship, The Rose and Crown, The Talbot, The King's Head and The White Hart. In the 18th Century the London to Brighton coach route ran through Cuckfield and many travellers broke their journey spending the night at one of these inns. The most talked about pub in Cuckfield is the New King's Head built early 19th Century. The Old King's Head (coaching inn) where George IV once stayed was demolished early 19th Century. Two ghosts are said to haunt the present building. One is known as 'The Grey Lady' who haunts one of the bedrooms. The other is known as 'Geranium Jane' so called because her jealous lover is meant to have killed her by dropping a well aimed pot of geraniums on her head.
